intro: Ruellia leucobracteatus, commonly known as the white bract ruellia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of white to purple. Its blooms are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Ruellia leucobracteatus is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and adaptability to various growing conditions.
